If you're an avid online shopper, you know the struggle of trying to find the best deals and coupons to save some extra money. But what if there was a tool that could do all the hard work for you and find the best deals automatically? Meet WikiBuy – the ultimate shopping assistant that will help you save money while shopping online.

## What Is WikiBuy?

WikiBuy is a free browser extension that automatically compares prices, finds deals and coupons, and alerts you when prices drop. It works with a wide range of online retailers, including Amazon, Walmart, Target, and more. The software was acquired by Capital One in 2018, and since then, it has helped millions of users save money on their online purchases.

## How Does WikiBuy Work?

To use WikiBuy, simply install the browser extension on your favorite browser. Once installed, the tool will start working its magic. When you visit an online store, WikiBuy will automatically scan the web for the same product to compare prices. If it finds a lower price, it will alert you and provide a link to the website where you can make the purchase.

In addition, WikiBuy also tracks the price history of the items you're interested in. This means you can see how the price has changed over time, and decide whether you want to wait for the price to drop or buy it now.

## What Are the Benefits of Using WikiBuy?

There are several benefits to using WikiBuy. First, it saves you time and effort by automatically finding deals and coupons for you. You don't have to waste time scouring the web for the best price – WikiBuy does it for you.

Second, WikiBuy helps you save money on your purchases. By finding the best deals and coupons, you can save a significant amount of money over time. Plus, you can track the price history of items to make informed purchasing decisions.

Finally, WikiBuy is incredibly easy to use. Simply install the browser extension and let it do the rest. There are no complicated settings to adjust or preferences to select – it just works.

## Is WikiBuy Safe to Use?

Yes, WikiBuy is safe to use. The software has been rigorously tested and is free of malware and viruses. Plus, the tool is entirely free, so you don't have to worry about hidden fees or charges.

In addition, WikiBuy uses 256-bit SSL encryption to protect your personal and financial information. This means your data is safe and secure, even when using the software on public Wi-Fi networks.

## Conclusion

If you're looking for a way to save money while shopping online, WikiBuy is the ultimate shopping assistant you need. With its automatic price comparison, deal and coupon finding, and price drop alerts, you can save a lot of money on your online purchases without any hassle.

So, what are you waiting for? Install WikiBuy today, and start saving money on your online purchases!
